dt: {bc}the enciphering and deciphering of messages in secret code or cipher
{bc}the computerized encoding and decoding of information

et: New Latin {it}cryptographia{/it} was perhaps first used by the Limburg-born philologist Erycius Puteanus (Eric de Put, Eric van den Putte, 1574-1646) in "Cryptographia epistolica, sive de clandestina scriptione," an addendum to his {it}Epistolarum reliquiae centuria V{/it} (Leuven/Louvain, 1612). An apparently more widely circulated work using the word was {it}Cryptomenytices et cryptographiae libri IX{/it} (Lüneburg, 1624) by Gustavus Selenus, pseudonym of Augustus the Younger, Duke of Brunswick-Lüneburg (1579-1666).
shortdef: the enciphering and deciphering of messages in secret code or cipher; also : the computerized encoding and decoding of information
